meanings.sent1: She decided to resculpt the clay figure to make it more detailed.
meanings.sent2: The artist will resculpt the statue to fix the chipped nose.
meanings.sent3: After accidentally squishing the clay, she had to resculpt it into a new shape.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor had to resculpt the face multiple times to capture the right expression.
meanings.sent5: With skilled hands, he began to resculpt the rough edges into smooth curves.

meanings.definition: To reshape or alter through sculpting
meanings.sent1: The artist plans to resculpt the marble block into a beautiful sculpture.
meanings.sent2: Using a chisel, she carefully resculpted the stone to create intricate details.
meanings.sent3: In a playful mood, he decided to resculpt the sandcastle into a mini city.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to resculpt his feelings, changing his perspective entirely.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor's hands moved swiftly to resculpt the clay into a lifelike figure.

meanings.definition: The act of reshaping or altering through sculpting
meanings.sent1: Watching the resculpt of the clay figure was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: The resculpt of the stone statue took weeks to complete.
meanings.sent3: The resculpt of the landscape in the park brought new life to the area.
meanings.sent4: The resculpt of the artist's original vision resulted in a stunning masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: Visitors marveled at the resculpt of the museum's entrance, now a work of art.
